alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:41AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Volusia County through 415 AM EDT... At 340 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Juniper Springs, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pierson, Lake George, Eldridge, Seville, and Bakerstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for east central Florida.
